docs.snippet: With a view to the health and comfort of the volunteer troops in and near to the City of St. Louis, a Sanitary Committee is hereby appointed, to consist of five gentlemen, who shall serve voluntarily, and be removable at pleasure. Its general object...

headline.main: MATTERS IN MISSOURI.; THE SANITARY COMMISSION. HEAD-QUARTERS WESTERN DEPARTMENT

docs.lead_paragraph: With a view to the health and comfort of the volunteer troops in and near to the City of St. Louis, a Sanitary Committee is hereby appointed, to consist of five gentlemen, who shall serve voluntarily, and be removable at pleasure. Its general object shall be to carry out, under the properly constituted military authorities, and in compliance with their orders, such sanitary regulations and reforms as the well-being of the soldiers demand.

docs.snippet: A DUEL WITH BROADSWORDS GAMBLERS AND THEIR HONOR. The sporting fraternity they who, arrayed in fine apparel, stand musingly upon Broadway corners; whose hirsute appendages are of the longest and sleekest, and whose manners are more than...
docs.lead_paragraph: A DUEL WITH BROADSWORDS GAMBLERS AND THEIR HONOR. The sporting fraternity they who, arrayed in fine apparel, stand musingly upon Broadway corners; whose hirsute appendages are of the longest and sleekest, and whose manners are more than Chesterfieldian does not often allow itself to exhibit the vulgar excitement which marked it yesterday. The occasion of this disturbed equanimity, however, was excusable.

docs.snippet: We hear of no movement of either of the armies of the Potomac. BEAUREGARD has not taken Washington. Neither has he made any demonstration towards Baltimore or Philadelphia. In fact, the rapid movement of National troops toward the capital, together...
docs.lead_paragraph: We hear of no movement of either of the armies of the Potomac. BEAUREGARD has not taken Washington. Neither has he made any demonstration towards Baltimore or Philadelphia. In fact, the rapid movement of National troops toward the capital, together with the corps d'armee congregated there, would seem to render such an undertaking extremely hazardous. The health of our Army is excellent.

headline.main: INTERESTING FROM FRANCE.; Effect of Prince Napoleon's Voyage in the North--What the Moniteur Says-Wants of the Army--The French Soldier--A Slave Drama on Parisian Boards--A New Maritime Decree.

docs.lead_paragraph: It is worthy of passing remark, as an indication of the times, that since the return of Prince NAPOLEON to the North from his visit to the Confederate Army at Manassas, the Moniteur has published several Courriers d' Amerique, made up from "private correspondence," which are extremely partial to the North and the cause of the Union. headline.main: THE REBELLION.; No Movement of the Armies of the Potomac. SKIRMISH AT SENECA CREEK. THE REBELS DRIVEN BACK Our Army in Excellent Condition. Rumored Advance of Gen. Johnston. MORE SUCCESSES IN THE WEST. Wholesale Arrest of Members of the Maryland Legislature. Great Success of the National Loan-- List of Agents Appointed. Efficiency of the Blockade of the Mississippi. EXCELLENT HEALTH OF THE ARMY. EXTRA CABINET MEETING. GEN. FREMONT'S DIFFICULTIES. OUSTING TRAITORS. AN ARRIVAL FROM VIRGINIA--WANEON DESTRUCTION OF PROPERTY. THE NATIONAL LOAN. NO ACTIVE WAR MOVEMENTS. MARYLAND SECESSIONISTS DEFEATED. MISCELLANEOUS.
